column1: Smoque BBQ////I am not totally sure what the hype is.  It is a very small place
column4: with an inefficient ordering system that results in people waiting an hour to get in
column5: so it looks way busier than it really is. The BBQ is good
column6: but I didn't think it was wait in line for an hour good.  The portions are generous. The pulled pork and brisket were better than the ribs in our opinion.  The sauces and sides are heavy on the vinegar flavor.  The cornbread was very good.  For desert we ordered peach cobbler
column8: and a pecan bread pudding with caramel sauce which was very good (probably the best part of our dinner.)  The service was pretty good
